summary: Forced labor is a global problem affecting millions of people, according to the United Nations. U.S. law prohibits imports produced with forced labor, including seafood. Customs and Border Protection, responsible for enforcement, established a forced labor division in 2018 to focus on identifying such imports. CBP uses information from external sources to help identify seafood imports produced with forced labor, but may be missing opportunities...
title: Forced Labor: Better Communication Could Improve Trade Enforcement Efforts Related to Seafood
